intro: Calamintha officinalis var. stricta, commonly known as narrowleaf catnip, is a perennial herb native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring opposite, narrow, and slightly serrated leaves. Its small, pale blue to lavender flowers are clustered in whorls along the stems, blooming in late spring to early summer. The leaves and flowers are often used in herbal teas and traditional medicine for their mild sedative and carminative properties.
